page.title: 06FARMING IN THE AREA
page.content: There are 11 farming families in the area: Sheardown, White, Orrey,Wright, Gray, Pearson(2), Winter, Haywood, Critchley and Hickson. The main landowners are the Church, Whites, and Sheardowns. Most farms are run by the family they belong to although some farm workers are employed on a full time or casual basis. The land is mainly arable; wheat, barley, rape, peas, carrots, potatoes, sugar beet and spring barley. Mr. Wright keeps turkeys, and Mr. Orrey pigs. Mr. Haywood farms 113 hectares and grows mainly winter wheat. A third of this is used for milling, and two-thirds for animal feed and export or intervention. His farm machinery includes 3 tractors, combined harvester,potato harvester, and harrow
